routes.name: SECOND MOVEMENT
routes.description: This is the first large corner right of the descent.Gain height for 10m until you arrive at the top. Limpet Line VD. Start 2m R of Second Movement and climb on flat holds to the top. Well, Well VD Start 4m L of the large recess containing Numero Uno and Doyle's Corner, at the foot of a narrow R-facing wall. Climb the centre of the wall to the top. Chiton Class VD Start just R of Well, Well and climb the face at right-angles to that route. Bridge Out VD Start 2m R of Chiton Class and climb up to and through a corner. NUMERO UNO S Just R of Bridge Out is a large recessed wall with an overhang at 4m and two opposing corners.This route goes up a slippery slab to the base of the left hand corner of the recess and straight up. DOYLE'S CORNER D This route takes the right hand corner of the recess used by Numero Uno. Mussel On VS 4b Start 2 m R of Doyle's Corner, beneath an overhang at half-height. Climb direct to the top. Pilgrims M.S. Start 2m R of Mussel On and climb direct to top. AVOIDING THE OBVIOUS HS 4b 13m right of Doyle's Corner there is a deep groove which overhangs at 1/4 and 2/3 height, with white moss at its base. Start up the groove but trend left after 2m to a corner and go straight up. ON THE BEACH HS 4b Once again start up the white mossed groove but rather than Avoiding The Obvious go left at the first overhang, back right again and then left at the second overhang. Via Media HS 4a Start as for Guido Doylo, but move L after 2m and climb diagonally L to finish up the corner L of Guido Doylo. GUIDO DOYLO VS 4b This is 4m right of the Avoiding The Obvious groove, and directly under a right facing V groove at the top. Start at a small overhang with a crack and climb direct to the groove and thence the top. WHITE STAIN ON A BLACK HEAD VS 4b Start 3m R of Guido Doylo at a small ledge which has a puddle 1m up and a white calcite stain at 3m which is 4m below a block with a crack on the right. Climb the overhangs to a shallow groove and finish up this. White Knight VS 4b Start just R of White Stain and climb steeply to a narrow ledge at 4m. Continue, bearing slightly L, to finish up 2m R of White Stain. MALLORY TOWERS HS 4b Start at the blocky arête right of WHITE STAIN on the right-hand side of the arête. Traverse left at 2m to the left hand side and then follow the arête to the top. WANDERLY WAGON HVS 5a The most unusual wagon you ever saw is to the left of a large rockfall scar where there is some lightly coloured rock. The route starts here and trends left to a triangular overhang. Swing around this on the left and on up to the top. The crux is at the bottom and after this the route gives easy climbing. BIM VS 4b Follow bulges (which bulges and where they are hasn't been alluded to) to a V slot at the top. PEABRAIN HVS 5a This route is right of the rockfall mentioned in Wanderly Wagon and takes a right trending line of short corners and finishes up left. There is a variation 4b finish which goes right in an airy position on good holds. SHEEG-SHAAG VS 4b A zigzag line running between Peabrain and Frog. FROG ON A COLD SLIMY ROOF HVS 5a Climb up from the left (of what I don't rightly know) to a large overhang at 4m and take it on the right. Go straight up over a smaller overhang. BLANCHE HVS 5a Possibly due to murky conditions, or some such atmospheric anomaly, the first ascensionists seem unable to indicate where this starts, your guess is as good as mine. Here it is, word for word. Follow the overhanging arête and grooves. Good route. THE MAD WART E1 5b Start at the bottomless groove of BAM but instead of pulling up into the groove, pull through the first roof just left of it. Long reaches gain positive holds. Finish up the easy corner. BAM E2 5b Follow the bottomless groove on the right of Blanche (ha haa haaa!). Go right at the roof above to gain a right facing groove shared with Radio Darren. An excellent route giving technical climbing on small holds lower down (crux) and climbing of a more strenuous nature higher up but on the characteristic Aughris 'bucket' holds. Low in the grade. RADIO DARREN HVS 5a Start just left of the first large area of green moss. Go through overhangs to finish up a right facing groove shared with Bam. PORPOISE HVS 5a Good wall climbing that's easier than it looks. Start 3m left of Grievous Bodily Charm and go left of a large roof, to trend rightwards up the wall to a small groove with an overhang at the top. GRIEVOUS BODILY CHARM E1 5b This starts below one of the few obvious features on the crag. Start below a large triangular roof at about 10m which has a crack running through it (takes Friend 3-3.5). Climb the arête to the roof and step out right into the bottom of a hanging corner on the right hand side of the roof. Here good friend protection can be arranged. Climb into the corner on small holds (crux) and go left up the wall above to the top. An excellent route with the crux being 'only' vertical and on small holds. UNFINISHED SYMPHONY HVS 4c To the right of Grevious Bodily Charm there is a large area of slime running the full height of the cliff, a first ascent is yet to be made. Unfinished Symphony is right of this and climbs between two green slimes - yummy ! The top half is unprotected. Go right up the wall to a right facing corner. SO LONG AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH E1 5b This route takes the dry overhanging wall to the left of Bem and to the right of a another slimy area. Fairly high in its grade. Go up left to a large overhang and take it directly. Continue straight up the wall surmounting smaller overhangs. Traverse right at the top to finish as for Bem. Superb climbing. BEM E1 5b A close relation to Bim and Bam, this route takes a series of shallow grooves through an obvious and impressive overhanging mini buttress just left of an area of more continuous slime. With it overhanging possibly 1 in 4 it looks intimidating but the climbing is more amenable than at first sight. Start at the right hand side of the buttress and trend left through a series of grooves to a resting ledge. Go straight up the overhanging groove and finish by trending left near the top, though trending right is also quite feasible. Finishes just right of a fence at the top which is a useful landmark. The crux is possibly near the bottom due to the start being a little slimy. An excellent exposed route on massive holds and low in the grade. These two routes are located at the first big inlet and start from just above a platform on the Eastern side. Abseil down to a small ledge 5m above the platform. SWING TIME E3 5c Takes the wall right of BEM where the slime almost runs the full height of the crag. Climb right of the streak on surprisingly dry rock. Steep and strenuous from the start. High on the right is a short green streak. Climb left of this. Good thread runner on the left. Step up and right once past the short green streak and finish on good holds with a massive pump. BOM VS 4c The last of the the B-specials climbs the right hand groove onto the wall and trends right following the contour of the cave to the top. DISAPPOINTING BASTILE VS 4c

BIM VS 4b Follow bulges (which bulges and where they are hasn't been alluded to) to a V slot at the top. PEABRAIN HVS 5a This route is right of the rockfall mentioned in Wanderly Wagon and takes a right trending line of short corners and finishes up left. There is a variation 4b finish which goes right in an airy position on good holds. SHEEG-SHAAG VS 4b A zigzag line running between Peabrain and Frog. FROG ON A COLD SLIMY ROOF HVS 5a Climb up from the left (of what I don't rightly know) to a large overhang at 4m and take it on the right. Go straight up over a smaller overhang. BLANCHE HVS 5a Possibly due to murky conditions, or some such atmospheric anomaly, the first ascensionists seem unable to indicate where this starts, your guess is as good as mine. Here it is, word for word. Follow the overhanging arête and grooves. Good route. THE MAD WART E1 5b Start at the bottomless groove of BAM but instead of pulling up into the groove, pull through the first roof just left of it. Long reaches gain positive holds. Finish up the easy corner. BAM E2 5b Follow the bottomless groove on the right of Blanche (ha haa haaa!). Go right at the roof above to gain a right facing groove shared with Radio Darren. An excellent route giving technical climbing on small holds lower down (crux) and climbing of a more strenuous nature higher up but on the characteristic Aughris 'bucket' holds. Low in the grade. RADIO DARREN HVS 5a Start just left of the first large area of green moss. Go through overhangs to finish up a right facing groove shared with Bam. PORPOISE HVS 5a Good wall climbing that's easier than it looks. Start 3m left of Grievous Bodily Charm and go left of a large roof, to trend rightwards up the wall to a small groove with an overhang at the top. GRIEVOUS BODILY CHARM E1 5b This starts below one of the few obvious features on the crag. Start below a large triangular roof at about 10m which has a crack running through it (takes Friend 3-3.5). Climb the arête to the roof and step out right into the bottom of a hanging corner on the right hand side of the roof. Here good friend protection can be arranged. Climb into the corner on small holds (crux) and go left up the wall above to the top. An excellent route with the crux being 'only' vertical and on small holds. UNFINISHED SYMPHONY HVS 4c To the right of Grevious Bodily Charm there is a large area of slime running the full height of the cliff, a first ascent is yet to be made. Unfinished Symphony is right of this and climbs between two green slimes - yummy ! The top half is unprotected. Go right up the wall to a right facing corner. SO LONG AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH E1 5b This route takes the dry overhanging wall to the left of Bem and to the right of a another slimy area. Fairly high in its grade. Go up left to a large overhang and take it directly. Continue straight up the wall surmounting smaller overhangs. Traverse right at the top to finish as for Bem. Superb climbing. BEM E1 5b A close relation to Bim and Bam, this route takes a series of shallow grooves through an obvious and impressive overhanging mini buttress just left of an area of more continuous slime. With it overhanging possibly 1 in 4 it looks intimidating but the climbing is more amenable than at first sight. Start at the right hand side of the buttress and trend left through a series of grooves to a resting ledge. Go straight up the overhanging groove and finish by trending left near the top, though trending right is also quite feasible. Finishes just right of a fence at the top which is a useful landmark. The crux is possibly near the bottom due to the start being a little slimy. An excellent exposed route on massive holds and low in the grade. These two routes are located at the first big inlet and start from just above a platform on the Eastern side. Abseil down to a small ledge 5m above the platform. SWING TIME E3 5c Takes the wall right of BEM where the slime almost runs the full height of the crag. Climb right of the streak on surprisingly dry rock. Steep and strenuous from the start. High on the right is a short green streak. Climb left of this. Good thread runner on the left. Step up and right once past the short green streak and finish on good holds with a massive pump. BOM VS 4c The last of the the B-specials climbs the right hand groove onto the wall and trends right following the contour of the cave to the top. DISAPPOINTING BASTILE VS 4c

routes.name: DOYLE'S CORNER
routes.description: This route takes the right hand corner of the recess used by Numero Uno. Mussel On VS 4b Start 2 m R of Doyle's Corner, beneath an overhang at half-height. Continue, bearing slightly L, to finish up 2m R of White Stain. MALLORY TOWERS HS 4b Start at the blocky arête right of WHITE STAIN on the right-hand side of the arête. Traverse left at 2m to the left hand side and then follow the arête to the top. WANDERLY WAGON HVS 5a The most unusual wagon you ever saw is to the left of a large rockfall scar where there is some lightly coloured rock. The route starts here and trends left to a triangular overhang. Swing around this on the left and on up to the top. The crux is at the bottom and after this the route gives easy climbing. BIM VS 4b Follow bulges (which bulges and where they are hasn't been alluded to) to a V slot at the top. PEABRAIN HVS 5a This route is right of the rockfall mentioned in Wanderly Wagon and takes a right trending line of short corners and finishes up left. There is a variation 4b finish which goes right in an airy position on good holds. SHEEG-SHAAG VS 4b A zigzag line running between Peabrain and Frog. FROG ON A COLD SLIMY ROOF HVS 5a Climb up from the left (of what I don't rightly know) to a large overhang at 4m and take it on the right. Go straight up over a smaller overhang. BLANCHE HVS 5a Possibly due to murky conditions, or some such atmospheric anomaly, the first ascensionists seem unable to indicate where this starts, your guess is as good as mine. Here it is, word for word. Follow the overhanging arête and grooves. Good route. THE MAD WART E1 5b Start at the bottomless groove of BAM but instead of pulling up into the groove, pull through the first roof just left of it. Long reaches gain positive holds. Finish up the easy corner. BAM E2 5b Follow the bottomless groove on the right of Blanche (ha haa haaa!). Go right at the roof above to gain a right facing groove shared with Radio Darren. An excellent route giving technical climbing on small holds lower down (crux) and climbing of a more strenuous nature higher up but on the characteristic Aughris 'bucket' holds. Low in the grade. RADIO DARREN HVS 5a Start just left of the first large area of green moss. Go through overhangs to finish up a right facing groove shared with Bam. PORPOISE HVS 5a Good wall climbing that's easier than it looks. Start 3m left of Grievous Bodily Charm and go left of a large roof, to trend rightwards up the wall to a small groove with an overhang at the top. GRIEVOUS BODILY CHARM E1 5b This starts below one of the few obvious features on the crag. Start below a large triangular roof at about 10m which has a crack running through it (takes Friend 3-3.5). Climb the arête to the roof and step out right into the bottom of a hanging corner on the right hand side of the roof. Here good friend protection can be arranged. Climb into the corner on small holds (crux) and go left up the wall above to the top. An excellent route with the crux being 'only' vertical and on small holds. UNFINISHED SYMPHONY HVS 4c To the right of Grevious Bodily Charm there is a large area of slime running the full height of the cliff, a first ascent is yet to be made. Unfinished Symphony is right of this and climbs between two green slimes - yummy ! The top half is unprotected. Go right up the wall to a right facing corner. SO LONG AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH E1 5b This route takes the dry overhanging wall to the left of Bem and to the right of a another slimy area. Fairly high in its grade. routes.name: WANDERLY WAGON
routes.description: The most unusual wagon you ever saw is to the left of a large rockfall scar where there is some lightly coloured rock. The route starts here and trends left to a triangular overhang. Swing around this on the left and on up to the top. The crux is at the bottom and after this the route gives easy climbing. BIM VS 4b Follow bulges (which bulges and where they are hasn't been alluded to) to a V slot at the top. PEABRAIN HVS 5a This route is right of the rockfall mentioned in Wanderly Wagon and takes a right trending line of short corners and finishes up left. There is a variation 4b finish which goes right in an airy position on good holds. SHEEG-SHAAG VS 4b A zigzag line running between Peabrain and Frog. FROG ON A COLD SLIMY ROOF HVS 5a Climb up from the left (of what I don't rightly know) to a large overhang at 4m and take it on the right. Go straight up over a smaller overhang. An excellent route giving technical climbing on small holds lower down (crux) and climbing of a more strenuous nature higher up but on the characteristic Aughris 'bucket' holds. Low in the grade. RADIO DARREN HVS 5a Start just left of the first large area of green moss. Go through overhangs to finish up a right facing groove shared with Bam. PORPOISE HVS 5a Good wall climbing that's easier than it looks. routes.first_ascent: I McNicholl, P. Breen & P. Harrington July 1991
routes.description: Start at the bottomless groove of BAM but instead of pulling up into the groove, pull through the first roof just left of it. Long reaches gain positive holds. Finish up the easy corner. BAM E2 5b Follow the bottomless groove on the right of Blanche (ha haa haaa!). Go right at the roof above to gain a right facing groove shared with Radio Darren. An excellent route giving technical climbing on small holds lower down (crux) and climbing of a more strenuous nature higher up but on the characteristic Aughris 'bucket' holds. Low in the grade. RADIO DARREN HVS 5a Start just left of the first large area of green moss. Go through overhangs to finish up a right facing groove shared with Bam. PORPOISE HVS 5a Good wall climbing that's easier than it looks. Start 3m left of Grievous Bodily Charm and go left of a large roof, to trend rightwards up the wall to a small groove with an overhang at the top. GRIEVOUS BODILY CHARM E1 5b This starts below one of the few obvious features on the crag. Start below a large triangular roof at about 10m which has a crack running through it (takes Friend 3-3.5). Climb the arête to the roof and step out right into the bottom of a hanging corner on the right hand side of the roof. Here good friend protection can be arranged. Climb into the corner on small holds (crux) and go left up the wall above to the top. An excellent route with the crux being 'only' vertical and on small holds. UNFINISHED SYMPHONY HVS 4c To the right of Grevious Bodily Charm there is a large area of slime running the full height of the cliff, a first ascent is yet to be made. Unfinished Symphony is right of this and climbs between two green slimes - yummy ! The top half is unprotected. Go right up the wall to a right facing corner. SO LONG AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH E1 5b This route takes the dry overhanging wall to the left of Bem and to the right of a another slimy area. Fairly high in its grade. Go up left to a large overhang and take it directly. Continue straight up the wall surmounting smaller overhangs. Traverse right at the top to finish as for Bem. Superb climbing. BEM E1 5b A close relation to Bim and Bam, this route takes a series of shallow grooves through an obvious and impressive overhanging mini buttress just left of an area of more continuous slime. With it overhanging possibly 1 in 4 it looks intimidating but the climbing is more amenable than at first sight. Start at the right hand side of the buttress and trend left through a series of grooves to a resting ledge. Go straight up the overhanging groove and finish by trending left near the top, though trending right is also quite feasible. Finishes just right of a fence at the top which is a useful landmark. The crux is possibly near the bottom due to the start being a little slimy. An excellent exposed route on massive holds and low in the grade. These two routes are located at the first big inlet and start from just above a platform on the Eastern side. Abseil down to a small ledge 5m above the platform. SWING TIME E3 5c Takes the wall right of BEM where the slime almost runs the full height of the crag. Climb right of the streak on surprisingly dry rock. Steep and strenuous from the start. High on the right is a short green streak. Climb left of this. Good thread runner on the left. Step up and right once past the short green streak and finish on good holds with a massive pump. BOM VS 4c The last of the the B-specials climbs the right hand groove onto the wall and trends right following the contour of the cave to the top. DISAPPOINTING BASTILE VS 4c

routes.name: SAUSAGES
routes.description: Climb the corner, passing the short overhang on good holds on the left. Continue to the top on good holds. RASHERS 22m S 4a From the right end of the platform, move up to a large ledge, then up right to reach a groove which is climbed to the top. PUDDING 8 metres further west is another short corner. Climb the back wall on good holds, moving left near the top. AND EVEN MORE SAUSAGES HS The next corner right which is climbed on good holds.

routes.name: RASHERS
routes.description: From the right end of the platform, move up to a large ledge, then up right to reach a groove which is climbed to the top. PUDDING 8 metres further west is another short corner. Climb the back wall on good holds, moving left near the top. AND EVEN MORE SAUSAGES HS The next corner right which is climbed on good holds.

routes.name: AND EVEN MORE SAUSAGES
routes.description: The next corner right which is climbed on good holds.

routes.name: Codex 25 metres
routes.description: Climb the crack passing 2 technically difficult sections. Near the top step left onto the arete and climb the wall above using perfectly shaped pockets. Kindred Spirits 20 metres E2 5c Route starts 2 metres left of Codex and at the obvious 'letterbox'. Climb the wall above the letterbox and arrange gear in a rightward trending diagonal crack. Up and left of this diagonal crack there is a foothold. Make hard moves up to gain the foothold and rest. Further difficult moves (crux) and a horizontal break is reached. Easier to top. Breithlá 25 metres VS 4c Route starts 4 metres left of Codex and 2 metre left of obvious 'letterbox'. The route follows a faint crack up to an overlap at 6 metres. Climb the overlap up to an overhang at 10 metres. Climb this on the right and follow crack above to top. Choctaw 170 20 metres E2 5c Route starts in a groove 2 metres left of Breithlá. Climb the groove to the R.H.S. of the overhang. Arrange protection in the horizontal crack above the overhang. Move up with difficulty and get established on the horizontal crack. Continue by a combination of crimps, side pulls and smears (crux) to gain better handholds and then a small ledge and rest. Up slab more easily to top. Bluegrass 25 metres E3 6a Route starts 4 metres left of Breithlá. Climb the blackish groove which trends diagonally left at first and then diagonally back right to a stance below an overlap at 7 metres (first runner). Climb this leftwards to below an overhang. Climb the overhang (hard moves) and get established on small holds (poor rest) at the base of 2 parallel faint cracks (small wire protection). Climb these with increasing difficulty until respite is reached by gaining big T.G. jugs and ledge. Easy to top and block belay. Sligo Sloper 25 metres HVS 5a Route takes arete 2 metres left of Bluegrass. Slope up diagonally leftwards to reach arete. Climb this (crux) to large ledge below short corner. Up easily to top. Black Gold 25 metres E3 6a Route takes the black wall right of Codex. Climb the centre of the wall on large pockets to a horizontal break at 8 metres. Arrange protection and climb the wall by difficult moves, at first on the right, to gain a sloping foothold. Step back left to a small rounded pocket on the wall. Steady oneself and use crimps and side pinches for a few moves to gain a magic jug and gear. Up easily on pockets to top. Carpetbagger 23 metres VS 4b Route takes the first groove right of Black Gold. Climb up to a sloping pulpit and from here climb the groove. Step left near the top onto the arete. Climb easily to top. Ivy Groove 23 metres HS 4a Route takes next groove right of Carpetbagger. Climb to the pulpit and step right into the groove. Up this passing 2 steep sections to top. Crack a-go-go 20 metres VS 4c Route follows curving crack in centre of wall right of Carpetbagger. Start from large ledge. Follow line of crack to ledge below top. Up easily to finish.

routes.name: Choctaw 170 20 metres
routes.description: Route starts in a groove 2 metres left of Breithlá. Climb the groove to the R.H.S. of the overhang. Arrange protection in the horizontal crack above the overhang. Move up with difficulty and get established on the horizontal crack. Continue by a combination of crimps, side pulls and smears (crux) to gain better handholds and then a small ledge and rest. Up slab more easily to top. Bluegrass 25 metres E3 6a Route starts 4 metres left of Breithlá. Climb the blackish groove which trends diagonally left at first and then diagonally back right to a stance below an overlap at 7 metres (first runner). Climb this leftwards to below an overhang. Climb the overhang (hard moves) and get established on small holds (poor rest) at the base of 2 parallel faint cracks (small wire protection). Climb these with increasing difficulty until respite is reached by gaining big T.G. jugs and ledge. Easy to top and block belay. Sligo Sloper 25 metres HVS 5a Route takes arete 2 metres left of Bluegrass. Slope up diagonally leftwards to reach arete. Climb this (crux) to large ledge below short corner. Up easily to top. Black Gold 25 metres E3 6a Route takes the black wall right of Codex. Climb the centre of the wall on large pockets to a horizontal break at 8 metres. Arrange protection and climb the wall by difficult moves, at first on the right, to gain a sloping foothold. Step back left to a small rounded pocket on the wall. Steady oneself and use crimps and side pinches for a few moves to gain a magic jug and gear. Up easily on pockets to top. Carpetbagger 23 metres VS 4b Route takes the first groove right of Black Gold. Climb up to a sloping pulpit and from here climb the groove. Step left near the top onto the arete. Climb easily to top. Ivy Groove 23 metres HS 4a Route takes next groove right of Carpetbagger. Climb to the pulpit and step right into the groove. Up this passing 2 steep sections to top. Crack a-go-go 20 metres VS 4c Route follows curving crack in centre of wall right of Carpetbagger. Start from large ledge. Follow line of crack to ledge below top. Up easily to finish.

routes.name: Prego –
routes.description: (V. Schafer 15/4/08) Start 5m left of "Snow White" move slightly right up wall, through gap in heather ledge, to top. Stake belay. Juggy and well protected

routes.name: Steps to Heather –
routes.description: (A.Tees, V.Schafer, A.Carlin 19/9/08) less than 1m left of "Prego", is a diagonal stepped corner, which is climbed to a ledge. Continue up on steep rock with good holds in a nice situation Snow White – 20m (S 4a) (V.Schafer) This takes the obvious two tier corner, at the left end of the crag. Rattenfanger Wall – 15m (VS 4b) (A.Tees, V.Schafer, A.Carlin 19/9/08) This takes the wall between Snow White and Muck on Top. Start in the corner just left of the start of Muck on Top, and climb to ledge. Continue up wall above on small footholds just right of vegetated bank to smaller ledge. Start on small holds on RHS of wall, and move left to good cracks/protection in wall centre, and up right, to the top Muck on Top – 20m (S 4a) (V.Schafer, A.Tees 17/6/07) Approx 3m left of "Ox Stair" gain a ledge and a leftward rising crack to the bottom of a leaning corner crack. Climb it on good jugs, and continue directly to the top Part Man Part Biscuit – 20m (VS 4c) (J.Walls, V.Schafer) Start 3m right of Muck on Top and climb directly up, through overhang at 3/4 height (crux) to the top Ox Stair – 20m (VS 4b) (A.Tees, V.Schafer) Approx 4m left of the arete of "Vereker" this route gains the shallow right facing corners at half height, and up the vertical wall above using a large "Friend" in a pocket Teeling – 20m (HVS 5a) (M.Daly, P.Harrington 21/7/07) On the face, 1 metre left of the corner of De Cuellar. Climb delicately to gain a small rib. Gain the crack above and follow it through a bulge to the top Higher in Time – 25m (HVS 5a) (P.Cooper, A.Tees 19/9/08) Start in a niche between starts of 'De Cuellar' and 'Verecker'. Climb up to overlap then traverse delicately leftwards, grade then continuously eases with progress, to finish up the exit crack of 'Muck on Top'; taking the right hand exit De Cuellar – 25m (E2 5b) (M.Daly, C.McDaid 9/6/07) Start in the rightward facing corner just left of Verecker. Climb the corner to the base of an overlap. Surmount this to gain a good ledge. Following the crack with increasing difficulty to the top Verecker – 25m (E3 5c) (M.Daly, C.McDaid 9/6/07) Start at the base of the prominent arête left of Colmcille Corner. The route takes the arête. Make one move up the short wall left of the arête and step right to the edge. Climb the arête passing one difficult section to a rest ledge at the base of the final section. Place a small friend in a vertical slot and climb the technical wall left of the arête (crux). Gain a jug on the arête which steady’s one for the final exit moves. Nut and stake belay Raven – 25m (HS 4b)v (M.McGuigan, A.Tees, V.Schafer 26/1/08) Start below and right of the left facing corner leading to the large nest on the wall left of "Colmcille Corner". Climb from the lowest point, up and left into the corner, avoiding the nest as best you can. Continue up (airily) on good holds, left of the line of "Dont Touch That Tree". This route should only be attempted outside the nesting season Don’t Touch that Tree – 25m (E1 5b) (G.Thomas, S.Kennedy, V.Schafer (2/9/06) Takes the spectacular crack line to the left of Colmcille Corner. Crux is mid height 600px|Happy Valli topo pic Colmcille Corner – 25m (HS 4b) (A.Tees, B.Magowan, V.Schafer 28/5/06) Takes the most obvious corner on the crag Corcorans Fightin Sixty Ninth – 30m (E2 5c) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 7/4/07)

Following the crack with increasing difficulty to the top Verecker – 25m (E3 5c) (M.Daly, C.McDaid 9/6/07) Start at the base of the prominent arête left of Colmcille Corner. The route takes the arête. Make one move up the short wall left of the arête and step right to the edge. Climb the arête passing one difficult section to a rest ledge at the base of the final section. Place a small friend in a vertical slot and climb the technical wall left of the arête (crux). Gain a jug on the arête which steady’s one for the final exit moves. Nut and stake belay Raven – 25m (HS 4b)v (M.McGuigan, A.Tees, V.Schafer 26/1/08) Start below and right of the left facing corner leading to the large nest on the wall left of "Colmcille Corner". Climb from the lowest point, up and left into the corner, avoiding the nest as best you can. Continue up (airily) on good holds, left of the line of "Dont Touch That Tree". This route should only be attempted outside the nesting season Don’t Touch that Tree – 25m (E1 5b) (G.Thomas, S.Kennedy, V.Schafer (2/9/06) Takes the spectacular crack line to the left of Colmcille Corner. Crux is mid height 600px|Happy Valli topo pic Colmcille Corner – 25m (HS 4b) (A.Tees, B.Magowan, V.Schafer 28/5/06) Takes the most obvious corner on the crag Corcorans Fightin Sixty Ninth – 30m (E2 5c) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 7/4/07)

routes.name: Colmcille Corner –
routes.description: (A.Tees, B.Magowan, V.Schafer 28/5/06) Takes the most obvious corner on the crag Corcorans Fightin Sixty Ninth – 30m (E2 5c) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 7/4/07)

routes.name: Corcorans Fightin Sixty Ninth –
routes.description: (M.Daly, B.Proctor 7/4/07)

routes.name: General Humbert –
routes.description: (M.Daly, B.Proctor 4/11/06) Start 5 metres right of Colmcille Corner just left of fence. Climb up wall to flake at 4 metres. Climb directly up wall passing horizontal breaks (friend protection). Gain the base of a faint crack. Climb the crack and gain a quartz niche. Climb steeply up bulge to gain good jugs. Surmount the bulge (crux) and get established at the base of crack. Follow to top. Good protection Paddy Alley – 30m (E2 5c) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 7/4/07) Start 6 metres right of Colmcille Corner and 1 metre right of fence. Climb to obvious scoop. Continue to good ledge at base of thin crack. Climb this at first and when it peters out, (½ friend placement on the left) continue up the wall (crux) to rest. Follow the re-emerging crack to the top Poltroons – 25m (S 4a) (A.Tees, S.Kennedy, V.Schafer 2/9/06) About 8m right of "Colmcille Corner" climb one of two short corners, and move up left to reach obvious ledge. Steeper, but well protected, climbing leads directly to a second narrower ledge, from where a series of rightward trending steps leads to a vegetated ledge. Climb directly up clean wall to the top Spider – 25m (E1 5b) (D.Millar, V.Schafer Aug 08) This route climbs the wall and overlap between "Poltroons" and "Hellburner". Start 2m left of Hellburner and climb to right hand side of obvious overlap at 1/3rd height. Assemble gear and move diagonally up and left to obvious horizontal break and from here to spacious ledge above. Climb slabby wall left of the Hellburner corner to another ledge and then the top Hellburner 20m HVS 5a (M.Daly, C. McDaid 23/7/08) Just left of Rhiannon there is a right facing groove/corner. Climb this direct, through the bulge to a spacious ledge. Finish up via heather clad ledges. Very well protected. Rhiannon – 20m (E2 5b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly 9/6/07) Starts 3m left of the isolated boulder. Climb direct to the horizontal break (small cams), then technical and precarious climbing leads up the wall (RP's) through a "corridor", after which the angle relents. The technical climbing ends here, although its worthwhile to continue to the top of the crag via a dense heather ledge and a pleasant short wall of pink granite Eratic Bilko – 12m (VS 4c) (C.McDaid, M.Daly 9/6/07) Starts directly opposite the isolated boulder. Climb the crack direct until a prominent bulge is reached. Layback to the right and thinly pull through the bulge. Climbing ends here, (hence the 10m), but worthwhile to continue to the top via the heather ledges and pink granite described in "Rhiannon". Elizabethan – 10m (VS 4b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly 23/7/08) At the crags righthand extremity, there is a huge detached pillar/block. Start just left of this, climb the prominent left trending crack until a sloping leftward ramp is gained. Follow this to heather ledge Oxtail – 8m (S) (A.Tees, V.Schafer, M.Boner 17/8/08) The obvious big crack at the right end of the crag. Finish off at the top of the big flake, or continue up the slabs to the top Above and behind the main crag, there is a band of rock, including a free standing pinnacle Watchtower – 12m (S) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 4/11/06) This route takes a crack line on the left side of the pinnacle. Climb the crack to an overhang. Climb this, first on the left and then step back into the crack. Follow to top. Scramble off with care. Western Corridor – 12m (HS) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 4/11/06) This route is behind the pinnacle at the left end of this band of rock, at the highest point. Climb crack past a few ledges. Nut belay well back Another 800 Years – 10m (Hs 4b) (O.Castle, JP.Dunne, G.Byrne and A.Corkery 04/06/07) On the clean wall above the main crag. Approx 3 meters to the right of Western Corridor there is a vegetated corner. This route starts two meters to the right on the clean face. Climb on the vertical wall using postive holds and a small crack to a small ledge. From the ledge with a long reach and climb over the overlap (crux) to a good rest. Easier moves to the top. Nut belay well back to the left (excellent protection) About 100m to the right of the pinnacle, there is a 10m high band of rock approx 30m long, which yields the following routes Puzell or Bust – 8m (E1 5b) (D.Millar, V.Schafer 26/4/08) This route climbs the wall and crack to the left of Spacedust. Climb the short lichen covered wall via good breaks to a ledge at 2/3rds height. Continue up crack above via good holds and gear Spacedust – 8m (E1 5b) (C.McDaid, V.Schafer, C.Flynn 16/4/07) A few metres left of "Angel Delight". Climb the crack to a large recess, then climb the crack in the upper short wall (technical). Restitution – 10m (E1 5b) (M.Daly, P.Harrington, C.McDaid 14/4/07) Start approx 6m left of "Angel Delight". Climb the wall and gain the crack at about 3 metres. Following to top. Angel Delight – 10m (E2 5b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly, P.Harrington 15/4/07) This route takes the faint flared crack leading up to a small right facing stepped overlap. The direct line is taken throughout. Very bold top half.

Nut belay well back to the left (excellent protection) About 100m to the right of the pinnacle, there is a 10m high band of rock approx 30m long, which yields the following routes Puzell or Bust – 8m (E1 5b) (D.Millar, V.Schafer 26/4/08) This route climbs the wall and crack to the left of Spacedust. Climb the short lichen covered wall via good breaks to a ledge at 2/3rds height. Continue up crack above via good holds and gear Spacedust – 8m (E1 5b) (C.McDaid, V.Schafer, C.Flynn 16/4/07) A few metres left of "Angel Delight". Climb the crack to a large recess, then climb the crack in the upper short wall (technical). Restitution – 10m (E1 5b) (M.Daly, P.Harrington, C.McDaid 14/4/07) Start approx 6m left of "Angel Delight". Climb the wall and gain the crack at about 3 metres. Following to top. Angel Delight – 10m (E2 5b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly, P.Harrington 15/4/07) This route takes the faint flared crack leading up to a small right facing stepped overlap. The direct line is taken throughout. Very bold top half.

routes.name: Rhiannon –
routes.description: (C.McDaid, M.Daly 9/6/07) Starts 3m left of the isolated boulder. Climb direct to the horizontal break (small cams), then technical and precarious climbing leads up the wall (RP's) through a "corridor", after which the angle relents. The technical climbing ends here, although its worthwhile to continue to the top of the crag via a dense heather ledge and a pleasant short wall of pink granite Eratic Bilko – 12m (VS 4c) (C.McDaid, M.Daly 9/6/07) Starts directly opposite the isolated boulder. Climb the crack direct until a prominent bulge is reached. Layback to the right and thinly pull through the bulge. Climbing ends here, (hence the 10m), but worthwhile to continue to the top via the heather ledges and pink granite described in "Rhiannon". Elizabethan – 10m (VS 4b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly 23/7/08) At the crags righthand extremity, there is a huge detached pillar/block. Start just left of this, climb the prominent left trending crack until a sloping leftward ramp is gained. Follow this to heather ledge Oxtail – 8m (S) (A.Tees, V.Schafer, M.Boner 17/8/08) The obvious big crack at the right end of the crag. Finish off at the top of the big flake, or continue up the slabs to the top Above and behind the main crag, there is a band of rock, including a free standing pinnacle Watchtower – 12m (S) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 4/11/06) This route takes a crack line on the left side of the pinnacle. Climb the crack to an overhang. Climb this, first on the left and then step back into the crack. Follow to top. Scramble off with care. Western Corridor – 12m (HS) (M.Daly, B.Proctor 4/11/06) This route is behind the pinnacle at the left end of this band of rock, at the highest point. Climb crack past a few ledges. Nut belay well back Another 800 Years – 10m (Hs 4b) (O.Castle, JP.Dunne, G.Byrne and A.Corkery 04/06/07) On the clean wall above the main crag. Approx 3 meters to the right of Western Corridor there is a vegetated corner. This route starts two meters to the right on the clean face. Climb the crack to a large recess, then climb the crack in the upper short wall (technical). Restitution – 10m (E1 5b) (M.Daly, P.Harrington, C.McDaid 14/4/07) Start approx 6m left of "Angel Delight". Climb the wall and gain the crack at about 3 metres. Following to top. Angel Delight – 10m (E2 5b) (C.McDaid, M.Daly, P.Harrington 15/4/07) This route takes the faint flared crack leading up to a small right facing stepped overlap. The direct line is taken throughout. Very bold top half.

routes.name: Angel Delight –
routes.description: (C.McDaid, M.Daly, P.Harrington 15/4/07) This route takes the faint flared crack leading up to a small right facing stepped overlap. The direct line is taken throughout. Very bold top half.

routes.name: Coolgliding.
routes.description: J.R., W.J.W., G.M. 9/4/11. This climb takes the narrow crack 1m in from the left edge of the face. An easy start leads to a problematical crux. High in the grade. Start behind the hawthorn tree, directly below the crack. Up easily over blocks to the base of the short vee-groove in the small overhang. Arrange protection and climb the vee-groove, crux, continuing up the crack with interest.

routes.name: Plucked.
routes.description: J.R. G.M. 29/1/11. The wide crack just right of 1. Start directly below the crack. Climb easily to the base of the crack. Enter the crack, crux, and follow it pleasantly to the top.

routes.name: Hawkeye.
routes.description: G.M., M.C. 13/11/10. This route takes the thin crack in the upper face, just over 1m right of Plucked. Start directly below the crack and just left of a patch of heather at 2m. Climb some small jammed blocks to reach a ledge below the overhang. Follow the crack to the top, with excellent protection.

routes.name: Wind beneath my wings.
routes.description: G.M. M.C., 22/1/11. This route takes the twin cracks in the upper face, 3m right of Hawkeye. Start directly below the cracks and just right of a patch of heather at 2m. Climb to a ledge below the cracks. Follow these to the top. Well protected.

routes.name: Have a Gneiss Day.
routes.description: G.M. M.C. 19/2/11 A thin, poorly protected start, leads to better holds and gear. While escapable at several points, it nontheless gives interesting moves throughout its length. High in the grade. Start just right of Wind Beneath my Wings, at the foot of the thin crack slanting up diagonally right. Follow the crack, on small holds, to below the blocky overhang. Pull over this on flat holds and move up diagonally right, crossing the line of The Early Birds, to finish pleasantly up the short headwall between that route and Hawkwind.

routes.name: The Early Birds.
routes.description: G.M., M.C. 22/1/11. Start 3m right of Wind Beneath My Wings, at the foot of the continuous crack running up to a wide notch in the skyline. Climb the crack, which is awkward to start, with holds and gear improving with height.

routes.name: Featherduster.
routes.description: G.M. M.C. 29/1/11. Start by scrambling up to the foot of the overhanging corner at the bottom left of the gully. Climb the corner, crux, to a good ledge and continue up to finish between the wall on the left and the flake on the right.

routes.name: Stress Test.
routes.description: G.M., W.J.W., J.R. 9/4/11 Start below the left edge of the face. Climb direct to the jammed block, surmount this and continue to an airy finish. High in the grade.

routes.name: Tread Softly.
routes.description: G.M. J.R. M.C.13/11/10. Start at the lowest point, at the foot of a tongue of rock 2m right of the gully. Climb the thin crack, which starts above a niche and continues up through the small overhang, to a delicate finish. Low in the grade.

routes.name: Old Hawk Down.
routes.description: J. R., G.M. 26/2/11. Start almost 2m right of Tread Softly and climb the left branch of the Y-crack, finishing up the shallow right-facing corner.

routes.name: Just William HS.
routes.description: Start 3m right of the heather filled gully at the lefthand end of the central section, and just left of a tall niche, below a crack running up the height of the face. Climb the crack.

routes.name: Where there's a Will.
routes.description: Start just right of the niche and below the left end of a long grassy ledge. Tackle the long overhang at its left end (crux) and continue up the face on good holds.

routes.name: A Wandering Voice.
routes.description: Start 2m right of Sweet William, below the the short right-facing headwall. Climb directly to a ledge below the wall. Steep moves lead up the wall.

routes.name: Rain Dance
routes.description: Start: towards the L.H.S. of the overhang there is a rib that stands on the grass ledge. Climb the rib to the base of a crack. Climb the crack direct to the top. Good nut, friend and flake belays have been uncovered 6 metres back from crag.

routes.name: Jigsaw
routes.description: Start as for Rain Dance. At the top of the rib step right into the base of crack. The crack has three vertical slots that are used for protection and to make upward progress. At top slot, move right and up on small edges (crux) to gain crack leading to top. ===Inishmurray Wall=== The North East side of Hawk Rock has an overhanging wall that is up to 30 metres in height (Inishmurray Wall). The wall overhangs from top to bottom by about 2 metres. There are a number of crack lines in the wall. The descent path to the base of the wall is on the right hand side as you look out from the top of the crag. The descent path is accessed by turning right immediately after exiting from the forest. Follow the track down staying next to the wall until the base is reached (less than 1 minute). There is a final obvious 'step down' at the end of the descent track. The first route starts from this 'step down'. First Blood 20 metres E3 6a (1 rest) Route starts from the bottom of the descent track at the L.H.S. of the wall. From the top of the final step on the descent route, move right into obvious jam crack and climb up to the large ledge above. At the back of this ledge there is an overhang. From the top of the overhang, a crack runs out slightly rightwards, to the top of crag. Arrange gear in horizontal cracks below the large overhang. Pull up strenously into the overhang and place a good number 3 rock above in crack. Continue pulling up and surmount the overhang by hard moves to gain the base of the overhanging crack. Climb strenously up the crack to below the groove. (1 rest taken here). Move up and pull into the groove using a few poor jams. Climb up the groove and gain a jug on the wall on the left. Exit using a small 'spring board' at the top. Stake belays. Rubicon 25metres E3 6a (1 rest) Route starts 5 metres right of First Blood below a groove. The route follows the groove and the overhanging wide crack above. Climb up onto a large pedestal on the right at 2 metres. Step left onto the wall and gain the groove above with difficulty. Follow the groove passing another difficult section to the large ledge at mid-height. Good rest. Move slightly left to the base of the wide overhanging crack. Climb strenuously up the crack to where it widens to an off-width. Climb the off-width (crux) by using small edges on the left wall. Where these small edges run out, an aid point was used here to gain the large hand hold on the right at the top of the off-width. One arm rest possible at this point.. Good jams and jugs to the top from here.

routes.name: First Blood 20 metres
routes.description: Route starts from the bottom of the descent track at the L.H.S. of the wall. From the top of the final step on the descent route, move right into obvious jam crack and climb up to the large ledge above. At the back of this ledge there is an overhang. From the top of the overhang, a crack runs out slightly rightwards, to the top of crag. Arrange gear in horizontal cracks below the large overhang. Pull up strenously into the overhang and place a good number 3 rock above in crack. Continue pulling up and surmount the overhang by hard moves to gain the base of the overhanging crack. Climb strenously up the crack to below the groove. (1 rest taken here). Move up and pull into the groove using a few poor jams. Climb up the groove and gain a jug on the wall on the left. Exit using a small 'spring board' at the top. Stake belays. Rubicon 25metres E3 6a (1 rest) Route starts 5 metres right of First Blood below a groove. The route follows the groove and the overhanging wide crack above. Climb up onto a large pedestal on the right at 2 metres. Step left onto the wall and gain the groove above with difficulty. Follow the groove passing another difficult section to the large ledge at mid-height. Good rest. Move slightly left to the base of the wide overhanging crack. Climb strenuously up the crack to where it widens to an off-width. Climb the off-width (crux) by using small edges on the left wall. Where these small edges run out, an aid point was used here to gain the large hand hold on the right at the top of the off-width. One arm rest possible at this point.. Good jams and jugs to the top from here.

routes.name: Rubicon 25metres
routes.description: Route starts 5 metres right of First Blood below a groove. The route follows the groove and the overhanging wide crack above. Climb up onto a large pedestal on the right at 2 metres. Step left onto the wall and gain the groove above with difficulty. Follow the groove passing another difficult section to the large ledge at mid-height. Good rest. Move slightly left to the base of the wide overhanging crack. Where these small edges run out, an aid point was used here to gain the large hand hold on the right at the top of the off-width. One arm rest possible at this point.. Good jams and jugs to the top from here.

routes.name: SPAGHETTI DEWDROP
routes.description: Start at the lower entrance to gully at an obvious corner crack. 1) 21 m. Bridge up the corner, around the overhang to a stance. 2) 15 m. Climb the corner more easily to the top. DENTURES 20m S 4a A.Linton, D.Caughers Start just down from the col in the centre of the gully. Climb the clean curving crack to an overhang at 8 metres, easier to top. HUD'S PUD 17m S 4a S. Crymble, R. Huddlestone From the col climb the stepped clean crack on the left to the top.

routes.name: DENTURES
routes.description: A.Linton, D.Caughers Start just down from the col in the centre of the gully. Climb the clean curving crack to an overhang at 8 metres, easier to top. HUD'S PUD 17m S 4a S. Crymble, R. Huddlestone From the col climb the stepped clean crack on the left to the top.

routes.name: HUD'S PUD
routes.description: S. Crymble, R. Huddlestone From the col climb the stepped clean crack on the left to the top.

routes.name: GROUND ATTACK
routes.description: Right of the shattered section of cliff follow the obvious long crack over several overhangs on the nose.

routes.name: NOW A VETERAN
routes.description: 2m right of Ground Attack climb ledges trending left to exit.

routes.name: DOWNWARD THRUST
routes.description: Between Now A Veteran and Downward Thrust climb a crack to a ledge and move delicately and directly to a dubious exit.

routes.name: VERTICAL TAKEOFF
routes.description: Start on a large smooth flat rock below a big overhang. Swing up dynamically on the point of the overhang on fingerholds. Gain ledges on the left and trend right to nose and exit.

routes.name: SHORT AND CURLEY
routes.description: Start around the corner from undercut arête of Vertical Takeoff at a large box recess. Using small holds climb directly from the middle of the box to reach a good hold above on the right (crux). Surmount overhang and follow crack above more easily. Finish rightwards with care.

routes.name: FYF
routes.description: Start right of Vertical Take-Off and 3m right of box recess. Climb obvious weakness leftwards.

routes.name: LEGS IN SPACE
routes.description: J.Flanagan, P.Daly Takes groove and overhang 1m right of FYF. Move right at overhang then trend right.

routes.name: SHEFFIELD
routes.description: This route takes the black corner before a small zawn. Climb the corner to a slightly overhanging and loose-looking but stable blocks to top.

routes.name: BLOW INS
routes.description: P.Daly, J.Flanagan Takes the arête and short groove between Sheffield and Ardent.

routes.name: SHOCKWAVE
routes.description: Start just left of Ardent outside the zawn. Climb the obvious lightning crack on overhanging blocks to a platform (direct is 4a). Trend left to exit.

routes.name: ARDENT+F82
routes.description: Move into the zawn 4m right of Sheffield and climb the finger crack above steps. Climb to widening crack and platform.

routes.name: HAUGHEY'S HANDBAG
routes.description: Start outside the zawn face 3m right of Ardent. Pull up onto the nose and climb obvious steps to platform.

routes.name: GO FOR IT
routes.description: Start 2m right of Haughey's Handbag around nose. Climb obvious broken wall trending left.

routes.name: STRAY EXOCETS
routes.description: 1m from outside nose climb a small crack to a small platform and flakes to the top.

routes.name: SIDEWINDER
routes.description: Start 2m right of the Stray Excocet's nose. Climb the first obvious crack to an overhanging block. Hand traverse left and up the crack to finish.

routes.name: CEASEFIRE
routes.description: Start 2m right of Sidewinder. Climb groove to gain block then traverse left almost joining Sidewinder. Exit up an obvious small steep corner.

routes.name: GRINGO
routes.description: Just right of Ceasefire.

routes.name: BATTLE OF THE PLATE
routes.description: Just right of Gringo.

routes.name: PSYCHOLOGICAL WARFARE
routes.description: A.Currans, M.Mace, C.Cassidy, K.McConnel, J.Hamilton 3rd April '83 Start 4m left of Bomb Alley. Climb obvious rounded flake steps to thin exit on upper wall.

routes.name: BOMB ALLEY
routes.description: Climb directly up crack at cleft in wall at boulders.

routes.name: STONE RUN
routes.description: Right of Bomb Alley below overhang.

routes.name: TEAL INLET
routes.description: Obvious corner past large boulders, climb to overhanging block, pull up corner crack to platform and exit easily.

routes.name: ANTELOPE
routes.description: Climb the next corner right of Teal Inlet via steps and traverse left across platform to a vertical corner and exit vertically.

routes.name: SHELL SHOCK
routes.description: Start at Antelope and climb the vertical crack more directly.

routes.name: THE ROSE ARÊTE
routes.description: Takes the arête just beside and left of Airstrike.

routes.name: AIR STRIKE
routes.description: Start at the nose right of Antelope and 1m left of a zawn.Climb the widest crack. Start at an overhanging block and then climb the obvious crack above.

routes.name: ABJECT SURRENDER
routes.description: A poor attempt at climbing the arête left of Swing Wing. At the major difficulties step left and climb the loose wall first trending left then right to the top of arête.

routes.name: SWING WING
routes.description: Climb easily in obvious corner 3 m right of deep zawn slot.

routes.name: WING TIP
routes.description: Takes the arête right of Swing Wing. MALVENAS * 10m S 4a 5m left of Overshoot. Start below a small corner on overhanging rock. Crux at the top of the corner. CLOWN'S SMILE 10m VS 4b Climb to the large overhang. Bridge widely and pull into corner. Up corner and finish as for First Landing. OVERSHOOT ** 10m VD Start at the second corner 12 m right of Swing Wing. Pull up on overlaps to platform and exit vertically. FIRST LANDING ** 12m VD Climb through the overlaps, next corner right of Overshoot and left of Beach Head. BEACH HEAD *** 12m S 3c Climb directly up the corner with an overhanging block right of First Landing. BLUFF COVE+F106 ** 8m VD Just right of Beach Head. SEA KING At an overhanging nose climb to platform and obvious crack. VELMA * VS 5a To the right of Beach Head and Bluff Cove at the nose. Hand traverse to nose and swing up. Continue easily to top. SPLASH LANDING * 10m D Start at the first corner at overhanging ledge and pool. Climb around the pool and up the black corner crack. GO HOME GALTIERI ** 10m VD Takes first corner right of Splash Landing. ON A WING AND A PRAYER 10m VD Right of Go Home Galtieri below left side of box recess, climb onto obvious ledge into recess. Climb wall to easy ground on top to finish. ARGIE BARGIE 10m VD Start 5m right of On A Wing And A Prayer. Climb the opposite corner of the recess. Awkward. ELEVATOR LEVITATOR ** 10m S 3c Start right of overhanging ledge and pool at box recess. Climb first crack through small over-hanging block to exit. WHY DO YOU CALL THIS ONE PORKY? 10m VD Start just right of Elevator Levitator in box recess. Climb right-hand corner to ledge, then straight up wall. Good protection. ARGENTINIAN EXTREME ** 7m D Next rectangular recess right of Elevator Levitator. Climb directly. TUMBLEDOWN DARE ** 7m VD Climb directly the first corner at bridge-zawn. BRIDGE HEAD+F73 * 7m D Climb the bridged zawn just right of Tumbledown Dare either on the outside or on the inside. BECAUSE IT _____ PIGS 7m S 4a D.Cross, B.Gilmer Start in box recess just right of the descent. Takes the right corner. Climb up overhang using good holds and right hand wall (crux). Follow crack to finish. MERRY SEAMAN 7m VD R.Finlay, D.Seaman Start on the wall 6m left of Diversionary Tatics. Climb an obvious black corner beside the equally obvious flake. PLEASURE DOME 7m VS 4b Start at the left edge of the boulder of Combined Forces. Take a direct line up a thin crack to the top of the crag. COMBINED FORCES 7m VS 4c A few metres right of Merry Seamen. Start at a large black block. The route is a direct line from the boulder to a small overhang at the top of the crag. DIVERSIONARY TACTICS 7m VD R.Finlay, D.Seaman Climbs the obvious arête left of Direct Assault. DIRECT ASSAULT 7m VD R.Finlay, D.Seaman Climb the obvious crack line of prominent nose. LEFT MANOEUVRE 7m D In the recess right of Direct Assault. FLANKING MOVEMENT ** 7m VD Takes the wall right of Left Manoeuvre 2m right of a prominent nose. Climb into obvious squared corner of Left Manoeuvre then step right onto wall moving rightwards and up. MID AIR MANOEUVRE * 7m D The line just right of Flanking Movement. RIGHT MANOEUVRE ** 7m VD WAR WEARY AMNESIA * 7m VD A.Currans, M.Mace, C.Cassidy, K.McConnel, J.Hamilton 3rd April '83 Start on the right side of tower left of Lynx. Climb awkward line to gain obvious deep split. OOPS KNEES AND JAMS IT EASY * 7m VD Start just left of Funny Funnel. Gain ledge and climb the obvious crack with the jammed flake. FUNNY FUNNEL 7m D R.Finlay Start just left of Introductory Slither. Climb the chimney direct. INTRODUCTORY SLITHER 10m D R.Finlay + five Just left of Lynx, climb the obvious arête to the top up a series of high steps. LYNX *** 10m D Climb the square-cut corner. Awkward at top. PUMA * 10m D Bridge wide chimney to roof and continue directly to the top.

Climb awkward line to gain obvious deep split. OOPS KNEES AND JAMS IT EASY * 7m VD Start just left of Funny Funnel. Gain ledge and climb the obvious crack with the jammed flake. FUNNY FUNNEL 7m D R.Finlay Start just left of Introductory Slither. Climb the chimney direct. INTRODUCTORY SLITHER 10m D R.Finlay + five Just left of Lynx, climb the obvious arête to the top up a series of high steps. LYNX *** 10m D Climb the square-cut corner. Awkward at top. PUMA * 10m D Bridge wide chimney to roof and continue directly to the top.

routes.name: TUMBLEDOWN DARE
routes.description: Climb directly the first corner at bridge-zawn. BRIDGE HEAD+F73 * 7m D Climb the bridged zawn just right of Tumbledown Dare either on the outside or on the inside. BECAUSE IT _____ PIGS 7m S 4a D.Cross, B.Gilmer Start in box recess just right of the descent. Takes the right corner. Climb up overhang using good holds and right hand wall (crux). Follow crack to finish. MERRY SEAMAN 7m VD R.Finlay, D.Seaman Start on the wall 6m left of Diversionary Tatics. Climb an obvious black corner beside the equally obvious flake. PLEASURE DOME 7m VS 4b Start at the left edge of the boulder of Combined Forces. Take a direct line up a thin crack to the top of the crag. COMBINED FORCES 7m VS 4c A few metres right of Merry Seamen. Start at a large black block. The route is a direct line from the boulder to a small overhang at the top of the crag.
